scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The papers contain six letters from Kirkland chiefly re articles and stories she submitted, including "The Bee Tree" for publication in The Gift; subjects desired and payment offered by Graham's Magazine; a love story she plans to submit; and her work with The Union Magazine; a letter to E. A. Duyckinck asking him to look up some autographs for her brother. There are also two copies of an engraving of Kirkland.

did.unittitle: Carolina Matilda Kirkland to Messrs. Carey and Hart 1840 Dec 15

scopecontent.p: Discusses submission of "The Bee Tree" to Care and Hart for publication in The Giftmagazine; also requests an opinion on, and willingness to publish, an abridgment of Dymond's Essays on Morality, which she has prepared, w/ 1 typed copy.

did.unittitle: Carolina Matilda Kirkland to the Rev. Rufus W. Griswold 1842 Jul 20

scopecontent.p: Sends an article for possible publication in Graham's magazine and asks about subjects desired and payment.

did.unittitle: Carolina Matilda Kirkland to the Rev. Rufus W. Griswold 1843 Feb 20

scopecontent.p: Sends a story for publication and mentions a love story she will send; thanks Rev. Griswold for his long letter and hopes he will continue sending long letters which are much appreciation by Carolina Matilda Kirkland and Mr. Kirkland; requests payment of money owed

did.unittitle: Carolina Matilda Kirkland to "My dear friend" 1843 Jan 15

scopecontent.p: Comments on new "requisition" and her work with Union Magazine;mentions "Dilly"

did.unittitle: Carolina Matilda Kirkland to E. A. Duyckinck n.d.

scopecontent.p: Asks him to look up some autographs for her brother.
